alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Graham; Norton; Rawlins; Sheridan; Thomas (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Wind Chill Watch issued December 19 at 3:22PM CST until December 23 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Watch, dangerously cold wind chills possible. Wind chills as low as 50 below zero. For the Winter Storm Watch, moderate to heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of up to two to three inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Kansas and southwest Nebraska. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Watch, from Wednesday night through Friday morning. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Wednesday night through early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Extremely cold conditions will persist for nearly 36 hours. Snow and blowing snow are also possible Wednesday night causing travel to be very hazardous with these conditions.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Decatur; Graham; Norton; Rawlins; Sheridan; Thomas
